item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description: How is add_action() being used? What do the calls to it look like?

item.title: Ticket #3118 (Autop no longer working on posts) updated
item.dc:creator: ketsugi
item.description:
I did some further testing and can now confirm that it is actually [4177] that is causing the problem. Again, plugins are not broken, but the autop somehow gets turned off whenever one of these plugins is activated.

As before, I'm not sure if this is considered a bug, or if it is desired behaviour. If it is desired behaviour, may I request some documentation on [4177] so I know how to modify the plugins to prevent this autop breakage?

item.title: Ticket #3118 (Autop no longer working on posts) updated
item.dc:creator: ketsugi
item.description:
You're right; it is a plugin problem. However it seems that multiple plugins are causing this problem. My best guess is that it has to do with [4176] and any plugin that uses add_action, as this seems to be the common deminominator with the plugins that I found causes the problem.

I'm assuming for now that this is desired behavior, so I'm leaving this ticket closed.

item.title: Ticket #3119 (link_pages enhancement) created
item.dc:creator: _ck_
item.description:
A simple addition and shuffling of link_page code could allow an easy enhancement to allow BOTH kinds of numbers and "next page" links and also formatting for the current page, wrappers, bolding, etc.

  • some visitors need heavy-duty prompting clues...

ie.

<< 1 2 [3] 4 5 >> 

function link_pages($before='<br />', $after='<br />', $next_or_number='number', $nextpagelink='next page', $previouspagelink='previous page', $pagelink='%', $more_file='',$currentpage='%') {
	global $id, $page, $numpages, $multipage, $more, $pagenow;
	if ( $more_file != '' )
		$file = $more_file;
	else
		$file = $pagenow;
	if ( $multipage ) {
		echo $before;
		if ( 'next' || 'both' == $next_or_number ) {
			if ( $more ) {
				$i = $page - 1;
				if ( $i && $more ) {
					if ( '' == get_settings('permalink_structure') )
						echo '<a href="' . get_permalink() . '&page=' . $i . '">'.$previouspagelink.'</a>';
					else
						echo '<a href="' . get_permalink() . $i . '/">'.$previouspagelink.'</a>';
				}
			}
		}
		if ( 'number' || 'both' == $next_or_number ) {
			for ( $i = 1; $i < ($numpages+1); $i = $i + 1 ) {
				$j = str_replace('%',"$i",$pagelink);
				echo ' ';
				if ( ($i != $page) || ((!$more) && ($page==1)) ) {
					if ( '' == get_settings('permalink_structure') )
						echo '<a href="' . get_permalink() . '&page=' . $i . '">';
					else
						echo '<a href="' . trailingslashit( get_permalink() ) . $i . '/">';
				}
				else {echo str_replace('%',"$i",$currentpage);}
				if ( ($i != $page) || ((!$more) && ($page==1)) )
					echo $j.'</a>';
			}
		}
		if ( 'next' || 'both' == $next_or_number ) {
			if ( $more ) {
				$i = $page + 1;
				if ( $i <= $numpages && $more ) {
					if ( '' == get_settings('permalink_structure') )
						echo '<a href="'.get_permalink() . '&page=' . $i . '">'.$nextpagelink.'</a>';
					else
						echo '<a href="'.get_permalink().$i.'/">'.$nextpagelink.'</a>';
				}
			}
		}
	echo $after;
	}
}

item.title: Ticket #3118 (Autop no longer working on posts) created
item.dc:creator: ketsugi
item.description:
After updating from 4174 to 4178, I noticed that auto-paragraphing was no longer in effect on my item posts, although it still works in comments. I'm not sure if this is reproducible, as I asked around in #wordpress and no other svn user seemed to have the same problem. However I'm at a loss as to why this might be the case, and I'm hoping that it's due to some error on my part rather than a bug in the code, but I can't be too sure.

The issue can be seen at â€‹http://ketsugi.com

item.title: Ticket #3117 (lost of uploaded filepath of attachement) created
item.dc:creator: kingbyu
item.description:
Description of bug I used the inline uploader to upload an attachment (PDF) file. The file is uploaded into an uploads directory. When clicking the "using filename" button in the inline uploader options menu, the upload-directory path portion of the url is lost, leaving only the file name. For example, when the url should be: â€‹http://example.com/upload-directory/myupload.pdf it instead is just: myupload.pdf

Problem code: The problem comes from an incorrect ab entries which are created from a line in trunk/wp-admin/inline-uploading.php (currently line 251) which looks like: 

ab[{$ID}] = '<a id=\"p{$ID}\" href=\"{$filename}\" onclick=\"doPopup({$ID});return false;\" title=\"{$title}\">';

The problem is that a few lines earlier $filename was set with: 

$filename = basename($attachment['guid']);

and the basename() function took off all of the path part of the URL.

Suggested fix: Change line 251 to be: 

ab[{$ID}] = '<a id=\"p{$ID}\" href=\"{$attachment['guid']}\" onclick=\"doPopup({$ID});return false;\" title=\"{$title}\">';

so that the full filename is preserved.

item.title: Ticket #2695 (dbdelta duplicates indices instead of overwriting them.) closed
item.dc:creator: majelbstoat
item.description:
invalid:

In fact, it looks like this is a non-issue. After looking through the dbdelta code, I found that the function does check for existing indices but is just quite picky about what it matches against.

Basically, instead of using INDEX, you have to use KEY. You also have to give a name to any indexes you create. You also need to specify KEY when creating a UNIQUE constraint.

So, changing my definitions from: 

UNIQUE (code)
INDEX language_idx (language_id)

to: 

UNIQUE KEY code (code)
KEY language_idx (language_id)

fixed the problem for me. Closing as invalid - plugin authors (myself included) should just be very precise in their table definitions.

item.title: Ticket #2695 (dbdelta duplicates indices instead of overwriting them.) updated
item.dc:creator: majelbstoat
item.description: We can just test to see if it exists and if it does, not bother to add it. I'll take a look at doing that.

item.title: Ticket #3115 (tinymce image insertion/edit tool should have a class and a style box) created
item.dc:creator: RuddO
item.description:
How hard would it be to add this? I'm planning to do this for a customer, but I'd like it to be in WP mainline. I want to hear your expert opinion, guys, because I think this would be very beneficial for the users of the rich text post editor.

basically besides just alignment, the popup box should also have a CSS classes text box and a CSS style text box.

Give me pointers with determining what more or less it would take, I'll do it, and charge my customer, and roll it in into WP mainline. Whaddya think?
